001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
004import com.technototes.library.general.Periodic;
005import com.technototes.library.structure.CommandOpMode;
006import com.technototes.library.subsystem.Subsystem;
007import java.util.HashMap;
008import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
009import java.util.Map;
010import java.util.Set;
011import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
012
013/**
014 * This is a "singleton" object for scheduling commands. Most usage originates from {@link Command}
015 * methods {@link Command#andThen} or {@link Command#alongWith} for example. Outside of
016 * those usages, you will typically use {@code CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleJoystick} to
017 * control a drivebase.
018 *
019 * <p>
020 * TODO: The "CommandScheduler.getInstance()" thing is really kinda silly. Perhaps it's how WPIlib
021 * TODO: works, but it's clunky and makes things messier for non-FRC programmers. I think I'm going
022 * TODO: yoink that method and make static methods for next year's release...
023 */
024public final class CommandScheduler {
025
026    private static final Map<Command, BooleanSupplier> commandMap = new HashMap<>();
027    private static final Map<Subsystem, Set<Command>> requirementMap = new HashMap<>();
028    private static final Map<Subsystem, Command> defaultMap = new HashMap<>();
029
030    private static final Set<Periodic> registered = new LinkedHashSet<>();
031
032    private static CommandOpMode opMode;
033
034    /**
035     * Set the scheduler's opmode
036     *
037     * @param c the opmode
038     */
039    public static void setOpMode(CommandOpMode c) {
040        opMode = c;
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Forcefully halt the opmode
045     */
046    public static void terminateOpMode() {
047        opMode.terminate();
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Gets the number of seconds that the opmode has been executing
052     *
053     * @return elapsed time since opmode was started, in seconds
054     */
055    public static double getOpModeRuntime() {
056        return opMode.getOpModeRuntime();
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * Reset the scheduler...
061     */
062    public static void resetScheduler() {
063        Command.clear();
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * Schedule a command to run (just use "schedule")
068     *
069     * @param command the command to schedule
070     */
071    public static void scheduleOnce(Command command) {
072        schedule(command);
073    }
074
075    /**
076     * Schedule a command to run during a particular OpModeState
077     * You can just use scheduleForState instead...
078     *
079     * @param command the command to schedule
080     * @param state   the state during which the command should be scheduled
081     */
082    public static void scheduleOnceForState(Command command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState state) {
083        scheduleForState(command, state);
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * Schedules a command to be run during Run and End states, all the time.
088     * This is called "Schedule for Joystick" because joysticks don't really have a
089     * condition you might consider 'useful for triggering', so the command
090     * just runs repeatedly. This adds the requirement that the BooleanSupplier function
091     * is also true for the command to be run.
092     *
093     * @param command  The command to run repeatedly
094     * @param supplier The condition which must also be true to run the command
095     */
096    public static void scheduleJoystick(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
097        scheduleForState(command, supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.END);
098    }
099
100    /**
101     * Schedules a command to be run during Run and End states, all the time.
102     * This is called "Schedule for Joystick" because joysticks don't really have a
103     * condition you might consider 'useful for triggering', so the command
104     * just runs repeatedly
105     *
106     * @param command The command to run repeatedly.
107     */
108    public static void scheduleJoystick(Command command) {
109        scheduleForState(command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.END);
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Schedule a command to run
114     *
115     * @param command the command to schedule
116     */
117    public static void schedule(Command command) {
118        schedule(command, () -> true);
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Schedule a command to be run recurringly during the 'Init' phase of an opmode.
123     * This can be used for vision, as well as running any system to help the
124     * drive team ensure that the robot is appropriately positioned on the field.
125     * This will only be run if the BooleanSupplier 'supplier' is also true!
126     *
127     * @param command  The command to run
128     * @param supplier The condition which also must be true to run the command
129     */
130    public static void scheduleInit(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
131        scheduleForState(command, supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.INIT);
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Schedule a command to be run recurringly during the 'Init' phase of an opmode.
136     * This can be used for vision, as well as running any system to help the
137     * drive team ensure that the robot is appropriately positioned on the field.
138     *
139     * @param command The command to run
140     */
141    public static void scheduleInit(Command command) {
142        scheduleForState(command, () -> true, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.INIT);
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * Schedule a command to be run when the OpMode is one of the provided list of states and the
147     * 'supplier' boolean function is also true.
148     *
149     * @param command  The command to run
150     * @param states   The list of states to schedule the command
151     * @param supplier The function to determin in the command should be scheduled
152     */
153    public static void scheduleForState(
154        Command command,
155        BooleanSupplier supplier,
156        CommandOpMode.OpModeState... states
157    ) {
158        schedule(
159            command.cancelUpon(() -> !opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)),
160            () -> supplier.getAsBoolean() && opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)
161        );
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Schedule a command to be run when the OpMode is one of the provided list of states.
166     *
167     * @param command The command to run
168     * @param states  The list of states to schedule the command
169     */
170    public static void scheduleForState(Command command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState... states) {
171        schedule(
172            command.cancelUpon(() -> !opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)),
173            () -> opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)
174        );
175    }
176
177    /**
178     * Schedule the 'other' command (the second one) when the 'dependency' command has
179     * finished (but *not* been cancelled!).
180     *
181     * @param dependency The command upon which 'other' depends
182     * @param other      The command to schedule when 'dependency' has finished
183     */
184    public static void scheduleAfterOther(Command dependency, Command other) {
185        schedule(other, dependency::justFinishedNoCancel);
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Schedule the 'other' command (the second one) when the 'dependency' command has
190     * just started.
191     *
192     * @param dependency The command upon which 'other' depends
193     * @param other      The command to schedule when 'dependency' has started
194     */
195    public static void scheduleWithOther(Command dependency, Command other) {
196        schedule(other, dependency::justStarted);
197    }
198
199    /**
200     * Schedule the 'other' command (the second one) when the 'dependency' command has
201     * finished (but *not* been cancelled!) *and* 'additionalCondition' is true.
202     *
203     * @param dependency          The command upon which 'other' depends
204     * @param other               The command to schedule when 'dependency' has finished
205     * @param additionalCondition The additional condition necessary to be true to schedule the 'other' command
206     */
207    public static void scheduleAfterOther(Command dependency, Command other, BooleanSupplier additionalCondition) {
208        schedule(other, () -> dependency.justFinishedNoCancel() && additionalCondition.getAsBoolean());
209    }
210
211    /**
212     * Schedule the 'other' command (the second one) when the 'dependency' command has
213     * just started *and* 'additionalCondition' is also true.
214     *
215     * @param dependency          The command upon which 'other' depends
216     * @param other               The command to schedule when 'dependency' has started
217     * @param additionalCondition The additional condition necessary to be true to schedule the 'other' command
218     */
219    public static void scheduleWithOther(Command dependency, Command other, BooleanSupplier additionalCondition) {
220        schedule(other, () -> dependency.justStarted() && additionalCondition.getAsBoolean());
221    }
222
223    /**
224     * Schedule the default command for a given subsystem. The default command will be run
225     * if no other command is currently running on that subsystem.
226     *
227     * @param command   The command to be run when others aren't using that subsystem
228     * @param subsystem The subsystem to run the command against when it's unused
229     */
230    public static void scheduleDefault(Command command, Subsystem subsystem) {
231        if (command.getRequirements().contains(subsystem)) {
232            defaultMap.put(subsystem, command);
233            schedule(command, () -> getCurrent(subsystem) == command);
234        } else {
235            System.err.println("default commands must require their subsystem: " + command.getClass().toString());
236        }
237    }
238
239    /**
240     * Register a periodic function to be run once each schedule loop
241     *
242     * @param p The Periodic function to run
243     */
244    public static void register(Periodic p) {
245        registered.add(p);
246    }
247
248    /**
249     * Get the default command that is running on the subsystem provided
250     *
251     * @param s The subsystem in question
252     * @return the default command for the subsystem, or null if there is none
253     */
254    @Nullable
255    public static Command getDefault(Subsystem s) {
256        return opMode.getOpModeState() == CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN ? defaultMap.get(s) : null;
257    }
258
259    /**
260     * This gets the command currently using the subsystem provided
261     *
262     * @param s The subsystem in question.
263     * @return The Command currently using the subsystem, the default
264     * command for the subsystem, or null if there is no current
265     * command usint the subsystem, nor a default command
266     */
267    @Nullable
268    public static Command getCurrent(Subsystem s) {
269        if (requirementMap.get(s) == null) return null;
270        for (Command c : requirementMap.get(s)) {
271            if (c.isRunning()) return c;
272        }
273        return getDefault(s);
274    }
275
276    /**
277     * Register a command to be scheduled. The 'supplier' function is what triggers
278     * the schedule to begin running the command.
279     *
280     * @param command  The command to schedule
281     * @param supplier The function that returns true when the command should be run
282     */
283    public static void schedule(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
284        commandMap.put(command, supplier);
285        for (Subsystem s : command.getRequirements()) {
286            // TODO: Fail if a required subsystem is null, and maybe log something
287            requirementMap.putIfAbsent(s, new LinkedHashSet<>());
288            requirementMap.get(s).add(command);
289            register(s);
290        }
291    }
292
293    /**
294     * This is invoked from inside the CommandOpMode method, during the opCode.
295     * It it the core logic of actually scheduling &amp; running the commands.
296     */
297    public static void run() {
298        // For each newly scheduled command,
299        // cancel any existing command that is using the new command's subsystem requirements
300        commandMap.forEach((c1, b) -> {
301            if (c1.justStarted()) {
302                for (Subsystem s : c1.getRequirements()) {
303                    for (Command c2 : requirementMap.get(s)) {
304                        if (c1 != c2) {
305                            c2.cancel();
306                        }
307                    }
308                }
309            }
310        });
311        commandMap.forEach((c1, b) -> {
312            if (b.getAsBoolean() || c1.isRunning()) {
313                c1.run();
314            }
315        });
316        registered.forEach(Periodic::periodic);
317    }
318}
